text: Sometimes you need ways to shuffle...
I suppose so, I guess with top and scroll rack it would be useful thrn
Definitely, Top is why I play a fetch or two in Kiki-Jiki
The things I do for card quality
I play fetches to shuffle and for crucible of worlds
Also rings of brigthearth if thats in the deck
Those are good reasons too, I think most of you guys play with far more expensive cards than I can afford most of the time, I would love a crucible for my kozeilk deck, and a top for that matter
And a rings.... but that card keeps getting moved around to whatever my deck du jur is
in my playgroup we allow questionless proxies
nobody cares
it’s nice
i don’t use proxies, but i don’t want to feel bad about outspending my friends
I’m ok with a few, but when someone’s entire landbase is proxies I draw the line
I feel like that is my philosophy as well, you can make 80-90% as good of a land base without all the expensive lands

my group is pretty lenient on it. i like to foil out my cards, and it admittedly takes some time. as far as proxies, i don't mind if you're trying a card out before you buy it, or if a card is in the mail or whatever. but i also think it's ridiculous when people proxy up stuff like gaea's cradle, for example, which they have no intention of acquiring
for me, it's like why am i buying cards when everyone is playing with sharpie'd basic lands?
The only proxies I am running right now are cards that I can't be bothered to find in my pile of commons
i'm totally fine with that. like, that's a good reason for it.
with that being said, i'm fine with the gold bordered cards like force of will and stuff.
the worlds version or whatever
Yea, I'm with you guys <@U3M0Y065A> and <@U3L7A68JC>. when people get carried away and start proxying things they have no intention about ever getting then I get less patient about proxies.

We had a kid who would proxy basics because he couldn't find an art he liked, along with Gaea's Cradle, Chains of Mephistopheles and all sorts of stuff down to Brainstorms for other decks. We put to kibosh on it eventually. That and he was doing the naked anime girl proxies for some which we talked to him a few times about.
yeah that's ridiculous lol it even affects gameplay, it's annoying when i have to keep reaching across the table to reread what lands they have untapped and what they have in play
Just buy cards, you bunch of poors
Ha, when I was just getting back into the game I played a Rest In Peace and was accused of buying wins
yeah, peasants.

that's my favorite though. i play modern a lot, and i've owned a lot of my cards for quite some time now, a decent amount of them before the prices exploded. i had a guy a couple weeks back make audible sighs and roll his eyes when i played a verdant catacombs and fetched a godless shrine. "must be nice to have all these money wins"
like great, those comments sure makes the game fun for everyone involved.
You just look him in the eyes and say “Yup…why don’t you go get a job so you can experience it too?"
:smiling_imp:

One of my near to next favorites to that is the dude who has the fully foiled legacy deck that has to make serious life decisions between eating not-Ramen for the day or putting gas in his car. But he has 3 Tabernacles and he reminds you of it often.
That's why I proxy the more expensive cards these days, I want to pay rent most months
Moving to the twin cities and this new job, just can't cover all the expenses as is without going all in on a new edh deck
Yea, but you also aren't flaunting multiple copies a card that would cover all your bills for a month either.
Where in the cities do you live?
I live in Eagan, just south of the cities actually, we had a hell of a time finding a place before law school started up for the lady
Yea man, I used to live in Burnsville. I played football at Concordia too.
My best friend lives there now, one of the reasons why we moved here besides a good scholarship offer
Nice. St Thomas?
Or the U of M?
Mitchell Hamline, William Mitchell and Hamline school of law merged this past year
Is it called mitchell mitchell hamline hamline william now?
That is pretty much what I call it when I talk to the lady, on account that no one can remember the correct ordering
Ha, weird
<http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/magic-digital/state-magic-online-2017-01-31>

attachments.title: The State of Magic Online
attachments.text: Chris addresses the state of Magic Online.
attachments.fallback: MAGIC: THE GATHERING: The State of Magic Online

text: I don't even understand how they had a banned and restricted list that took a long time to change
anything is possible when you're dealing with spaghetti code written by someone else 10 years ago
I wish magic online didn't suck but I sympathize with their situation since I think most of their problems are just results of growing pains and lack of developer-hours
people gonna complain they didn't mention Magic Next tho
i can’t imagine coding the rules for cards
given the amount of money they probably make im surprised they dont throw more manpower at it
Elaine Chase did mention that they plan to keep MTGO running for the foreseeable future. That's a little reassuring when pondering what Magic Next is going to be.
I'm still wondering how the banned list isn't just an array of card id's or something
I always sympathize with those responsible for spaghetti code products of such notoriety.
I wonder what language its mostly written in…?
I’d guess C++
Yeah…given the age I suspect it’s a mix of C++ and C bits...
I could ask my friend, he used to work for that team I believe
It was either the MTGO team or the duels teams, it's been a while since I thought of it
He says C# for the client, cpp for the server, but that was two years ago at this point
It's moments like this when I realize I'm getting older. I still think of a C# as that newfangled language of Microsoft
i worked on C# as a microsoft intern in 2007
Shut up and get off my lawn!
I was still an ceramics major in 2007, what a time
Hey I'm a ceramics (well, MSE) major right now.
I made sculptures because it feels good to build thing said
Build things*
Home again home again jiggity jig
continuing our conversation from earlier: what if I proxy a card with a card that is worth way more? Like my Demonic Tutor is being proxied by my mox opal
Just buy cards
hahahaha
I think it'd be "sell the mox opal, you can't use it in the format anyway"
I'm considering making proxies for my money cards so I don't have to worry about theft at the very busy LGS I attend.

I've been meaning to sleeve all my cards in the same sleeve you I can switch out key cards between decks on the fly, but yeah I always worry about brining expensive decks with me to the lgs, I don't tend to bring more than one or teo decls
Just enough to play with and keep track of
As a note, friend said that they used to handle bans and such with a "god awful MySQL call to the data" which is why they used to get leaked all the time

if there are extenuating circumstances (theft being a major one), then i think it's fine to proxy. i frequently play at my LGS (3-4 times a week), and all of the people i play with are people i consider very close friends. i suppose i'm lucky in that regard. i don't worry about theft all that often...knock on wood
